alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Bamberg; Barnwell; Calhoun; Lexington; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Aiken, Bamberg, Barnwell, Calhoun, Lexington and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 254 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Swansea, North, Springfield, Salley, Neeses, Norway, Perry, Woodford, Livingston, Thor and Perry Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Aiken; Bamberg; Barnwell; Calhoun; Lexington; Orangeburg
